page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN WROTHAM
page.content:
The {transport} used in 1985 is private cars, trains, buses and bicycles. Trains and buses are on a timetable. On the timetable for 1985 there are 69 trains passing through Wrotham and Borough Green Station in a normal working day. There are fewer trains on Saturdays and Sundays. On the road going past Wrotham Secondary School about 3380 vehicles go by in one hour. A {motorway} surfaced with concrete runs from East to West and two main roads run from North to South with link roads to farms and estates. A regular bus service runs along the A22 with about 20 buses per day. The fare is about 15 pence a mile.
P. ROWE and D. PAYNE
